sprintGoal: Build Applicant Tracking System (ATS) for companies and analytics dashboards

tasks.title: Implement ATS backend for companies
tasks.description: Create applicant management system with pipeline, filtering, and collaboration features
acceptanceCriteria: GET /api/companies/applications returns all applications for company's jobs
Filter by: job, status, date_range, match_score, rating
GET /api/companies/applications/:id returns full candidate profile + application
Bulk operations: update status, archive multiple applications
Candidate match score visible to recruiters
Forum reputation and badges visible in candidate view

technicalNotes.tables: application_notes (application_id, user_id, note, created_at), application_ratings (application_id, user_id, rating), application_shares (application_id, shared_by, shared_with)
technicalNotes.activity: Log all actions: status_change, note_added, rated, shared

tasks.title: Build ATS dashboard UI
tasks.description: Create recruiter dashboard with Kanban pipeline and applicant management
acceptanceCriteria: Kanban board view with status columns (Submitted, Screening, Interview, Offer, Rejected)
Filters sidebar: job, date, match score, rating
Search applicants by name or email
Applicant cards show: name, photo, match %, rating, applied date
Detail panel: full profile, resume viewer, forum stats, application data, notes, activity log

tasks.title: Implement company analytics backend
tasks.description: Create analytics for job performance, applicant quality, and hiring metrics
acceptanceCriteria: Metrics: total_applications, views, conversion_rate (views → applications), avg_match_score, applicant_quality_score, time_to_hire, top_traffic_sources
Funnel visualization data: viewed → applied → screening → interview → offer → hired
Time series data: applications per day/week/month
Demographics: experience_level distribution, location distribution, models_expertise
Top performing jobs (by applications, quality score)
Comparison: current job vs company average

technicalNotes.aggregation: Precompute daily via cron job, store in job_analytics table
technicalNotes.time_to_hire: Days from first_application to first_hired for each job

tasks.title: Build company analytics dashboard
tasks.description: Create visual analytics dashboard with charts and metrics
acceptanceCriteria: Summary cards: total jobs, total applications, avg match score, time to hire
Click job row shows detailed job analytics

technicalNotes.export: Generate PDF with jsPDF and chart images

tasks.title: Implement candidate search for recruiters
tasks.description: Create talent pool search allowing recruiters to find candidates proactively
acceptanceCriteria: GET /api/candidates/search returns matching candidates (company premium feature)
Search by: skills, experience, models, frameworks, location, availability
Filter by: experience_level, remote_preference, salary_expectations, availability_status
Sort by: match_score, reputation, profile_views, recent_activity
Only returns candidates with visible_to_recruiters = true
Respects privacy settings (only show visible sections)
Search highlights matching skills and keywords
Export candidate list (CSV with contact info)
Track recruiter views ('who viewed my profile')

technicalNotes.search: Elasticsearch or PostgreSQL full-text search on candidate profiles
technicalNotes.premium: Feature flag: requires company premium subscription

tasks.title: Build candidate search UI for recruiters
tasks.description: Create talent search interface with filters and candidate previews
acceptanceCriteria: Advanced filters sidebar (skills, experience, location, etc.)
Candidate cards show: name, photo, headline, top skills, reputation, match %
Click card opens profile preview panel
Profile preview: condensed profile view respecting privacy
Premium gate (show upgrade prompt if not subscribed)

tasks.title: Implement bulk messaging for recruiters
tasks.description: Allow companies to message multiple candidates efficiently
acceptanceCriteria: POST /api/companies/messages/bulk sends messages to multiple candidates
Personalization: use candidate name, skills, etc. in templates
Rate limiting: max 50 messages per day (prevent spam)
Candidates can block companies from messaging
Message tracking: sent, delivered, read, replied

technicalNotes.table: message_templates (company_id, name, subject, body), bulk_messages (company_id, sent_at, recipient_count)

tasks.title: Build bulk messaging UI
tasks.description: Create interface for sending templated messages to multiple candidates
acceptanceCriteria: Select candidates from search results or lists

technicalNotes.preview: Replace personalization tags with sample data for preview

tasks.title: Test ATS and analytics features
tasks.description: Test ATS dashboard, analytics, candidate search, and bulk messaging
acceptanceCriteria: Application detail panel shows all data
Charts render accurately with real data
Bulk messaging sends to selected candidates

notes: Sprint 9 completes the Jobs Module with powerful tools for companies. ATS is critical for retention - make it intuitive and fast. Analytics should provide actionable insights. Ensure privacy controls are strictly enforced in candidate search.
risks: ATS performance may degrade with many applications - optimize queries
Bulk messaging could be abused - strict rate limits essential
Candidate search privacy enforcement must be bulletproof
